author: Nick Nairn
method: Heat the butter in a saucepan and gently fry the onion until softened but not coloured. Add the broccoli and stock, bring to the boil and boil rapidly for 3-4 minutes, or until the broccoli is just tender. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper and blend the soup using a hand blender until smooth. To serve, pour the soup into a bowl and top with a dollop of yoghurt.
ingredients: 30g/1oz butter,  ½ onion, finely chopped,  ½ head broccoli, chopped into florets,  150ml/¼ pint chicken stock (vegetarians can substitute vegetable stock),  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  plain yoghurt, to serve
